So, I mean so you have those
magic moments where you just go,

3032.text:
"Our life cannot
go on like this.

3034.text: This is not a good space to be."

3037.text: And you work out what gives,

3039.text:
and that's a constant

3043.text:

3045.text:
I mean, do experience

3049.text:
You know, how do you

3057.text:

3064.text:
at a time since my daughter

3072.text:
but their four year
old daughter who live

3078.text:
And I'm the primary bread

3083.text:
All of us have, and I

3088.text:
there's sort of two primary

in because he's a

And I think that that's

3107.text:
>> That would be an

3108.text:

3117.text:

3119.text:
it's not enough to stop raising

3125.text:
and to stop raising boys
to be perfect husbands.

3128.text:
I think we have to stop
raising children to think

3131.text:
that they're going to live
in an impossible set up.

3134.text:
And the marriage is
an impossible set up.

3136.text:
The two person marriage
with common children,

3139.text:
and no one else involved

>> Sorry I was just going

As an indigenous woman,

3196.text:
and I have a responsibility

3199.text:
And you know in thinking
about that, this conversation

3204.text:
and thinking about
what needs to change,

3206.text:
and you know I keep thinking
about you know the violence

3209.text:
against our women
needs to change.

3211.text:
Following our ways of knowing
and being and being brought

3216.text:
up by older women, our role
in a matriarchical society

3221.text:
because it's different for
us as indigenous women.

3225.text:
Our ways of knowing and being
is drastically different

3229.text:
We're raised to be caregivers
because as women, we're raised

3233.text:
with that understanding
that Ogawi Mawa,

3236.text:
our Mother Earth is
our one true mother,

3238.text:
and just as our Mother Earth
provides all those nurturing

3242.text:
abilities -- you know the water
of life, and provides everything

3249.text:
us as women it's
our responsibility

3253.text:
And so as a woman, you know,
in a marriage, you know I had

3259.text:
to make a very hard choice
back you know in 2011.

3263.text:
I had to choose, am I going
to have voice and speak

3266.text:
for my children, or I am going
to stay in an abusive marriage

3269.text:
and get my ass kicked
all the time.

3275.text:
And I didn't choose
to be a leader.

3277.text:
I didn't choose to
have a big mouth.

3282.text:
I don't have a choice
but to do this.

3287.text:
So I had to make a
choice to be a single mum.

3290.text:
I have a boy that I need
to raise to know how

3295.text:
to treat women, because of
colonisation he was failed,

3303.text: and his Dad was failing him.

3308.text:
I have a responsibility to her
to show her what she deserves.

3314.text:
So as an indigenous woman it's
my role to be a caregiver,

3323.text:
to nurture, and a part
of reconciliation,

3327.text:
you know my responsibility is
to teach my children's father

3332.text:
that he too has responsibility
beyond providing the basic

3339.text:
But he also has a responsibility
to love and respect me

3343.text:
as the woman who brought
life into this world for him.

3349.text:
In that I have a responsibility
to love him in return

3352.text:
and respect for the
walk that he walks.

3358.text:
It's not easy as an
indigenous woman.

3361.text:
When did it become
okay that I had

3363.text:
to choose being a mum
over staying home.

3367.text: You know, being with my children

3370.text:
over protecting their
basic human rights

3372.text:
to breathe clean air and drink

3376.text:
It's a bigger issue for me
than what it is for you ladies.

when they shouldn't be
